title: Ticket #5404: condor_shadow triggers kernel crash / job restart
description:
#### MESSAGE 1 #####

On Nov 13, 2015, at 3:46 PM, Patrick Brady <patrick@gravity.phys.uwm.edu> wrote:

Hi Juan, Stuart:

we've been trying to understand a behavior in a dag that ran at Caltech and would like some help. We have a test low-latency dag that was running at CIT in

/home/gstlalcbctest/observing/1/trigs_ts

The dag was restarted ar 11/11/15 06:27:29 and one of the jobs that we are trying to understand was submitted and began to be executed 

  11/11/15 06:32:38 Event: ULOG_SUBMIT for Condor Node gstlal_inspiral_0002 (27941471.0.0)
  11/11/15 06:32:54 Event: ULOG_EXECUTE for Condor Node gstlal_inspiral_0002 (27941471.0.0)
  11/11/15 06:42:54   Node gstlal_inspiral_0002, Condor ID 27941471, status STATUS_SUBMITTED

but then later 

  11/12/15 21:23:00   Node gstlal_inspiral_0002, Condor ID 27941471, status STATUS_SUBMITTED
  11/12/15 21:48:52 Event: ULOG_EXECUTE for Condor Node gstlal_inspiral_0002 (27941471.0.0)
  11/12/15 22:11:14   Node gstlal_inspiral_0002, Condor ID 27941471, status STATUS_SUBMITTED

So the job stopped executing for some reason and was restarted. We tracked down that the job was originally running on node628 and restarted on a new node around 21:48. Unfortunately, I don't know which node it was restarted on because I forgot to take a note of that before the dag was stopped.

I did log into node628 and there is an indication of a vacate request going to that node on 11/12/15 around 21:46, but we're not 100% sure what that was or where it came from.

Is there an easy way to understand? More than one jobs was affected by this. We don't have the details, but it could be extracted from the dagman.out file if needed.

Thanks for your help,

P

#### REPLY ####

Patrick, It looks like this is due to the following kernel bug that was introduced in the kernel we are currently running but has been fixed upstream, http://oss.sgi.com/archives/xfs/2015-09/msg00263.html I need to look a bit further but I suspect we will schedule a kernel patch/reboot on the cluster next Tuesday that will hopefully clean this up (along with another annoying warning we have been seeing for a while). Keep reading for more details.

From the Shadow log file it looks like there was a communication problem between the Submit machine (ldas-grid.ligo.caltech.edu) and the first execute machine this job tried to run on (node6280), and that it was then resubmitted to node605 where it ran for ~13.5 hours before it was gracefully removed. I no longer see that job in the queue on the submit machine. 

  [root@ldas-grid ~]# grep 27941471 /var/log/condor/ShadowLog
  11/11/15 06:32:48 Initializing a VANILLA shadow for job 27941471.0
  11/11/15 06:32:48 (27941471.0) (1902): Request to run on slot1@node628.cluster.ldas.cit <10.14.3.128:57976> was ACCEPTED
  11/12/15 21:38:03 (27941471.0) (1902): attempt to connect to <10.14.0.12:39278> failed: Connection timed out (connect errno = 110).  Will keep trying for 300 total seconds (237 to go).
  11/12/15 21:48:47 Initializing a VANILLA shadow for job 27941471.0
  11/12/15 21:48:47 (27941471.0) (15594): Request to run on slot1@node605.cluster.ldas.cit <10.14.3.105:42484> was ACCEPTED
  11/13/15 13:23:53 (27941471.0) (15594): Requesting graceful removal of job.
  11/13/15 13:24:40 (27941471.0) (15594): Job 27941471.0 is being evicted from slot1@node605.cluster.ldas.cit
  11/13/15 13:24:40 (27941471.0) (15594): **** condor_shadow (condor_SHADOW) pid 15594 EXITING WITH STATUS 102

On node628 the job starts, 

  [root@node628 condor]# grep 27941471 StartLog
  11/11/15 06:32:48 slot1_3: Remote job ID is 27941471.0
  [root@node628 condor]# grep 27941471 StarterLog.slot1_3
  11/11/15 06:32:48 (pid:14436) Job 27941471.0 set to execute immediately
  11/11/15 06:32:48 (pid:14436) Starting a VANILLA universe job with ID: 27941471.0
  11/11/15 06:32:48 (pid:14436) Output file: /mnt/qfs6/gstlalcbctest/observing/1/trigs_ts/logs/gstlal_inspiral_0002-27941471-0.out
  11/11/15 06:32:48 (pid:14436) Error file: /mnt/qfs6/gstlalcbctest/observing/1/trigs_ts/logs/gstlal_inspiral_0002-27941471-0.err

and in more detail from StarterLog.slot1_3 it failed to shutdown cleanly and report back to the shadow, 

  11/11/15 06:32:49 (pid:14436) Running job as user gstlalcbctest
  11/11/15 06:32:49 (pid:14436) Create_Process succeeded, pid=14438
  11/12/15 21:46:59 (pid:14436) Got SIGTERM. Performing graceful shutdown.
  11/12/15 21:46:59 (pid:14436) ShutdownGraceful all jobs.
  11/12/15 21:47:21 (pid:14436) condor_write(): Socket closed when trying to write 508 bytes to <10.14.0.12:48554>, fd is 16
  11/12/15 21:47:21 (pid:14436) Buf::write(): condor_write() failed
  11/12/15 21:48:05 (pid:14436) Process exited, pid=14438, status=1
  11/12/15 21:48:05 (pid:14436) condor_write(): Socket closed when trying to write 564 bytes to <10.14.0.12:48554>, fd is 16
  11/12/15 21:48:05 (pid:14436) Buf::write(): condor_write() failed
  11/12/15 21:48:05 (pid:14436) condor_write(): Socket closed when trying to write 77 bytes to <10.14.0.12:48554>, fd is 16
  11/12/15 21:48:05 (pid:14436) Buf::write(): condor_write() failed
  11/12/15 21:48:05 (pid:14436) Failed to send job exit status to shadow
  11/12/15 21:48:05 (pid:14436) JobExit() failed, waiting for job lease to expire or for a reconnect attempt
  11/12/15 21:48:05 (pid:14436) Returning from CStarter::JobReaper()
  11/12/15 21:52:03 (pid:14436) Got SIGQUIT.  Performing fast shutdown.
  11/12/15 21:52:03 (pid:14436) ShutdownFast all jobs.
  11/12/15 21:52:03 (pid:14436) condor_write(): Socket closed when trying to write 77 bytes to <10.14.0.12:48554>, fd is 16
  11/12/15 21:52:03 (pid:14436) Buf::write(): condor_write() failed
  11/12/15 21:52:03 (pid:14436) Failed to send job exit status to shadow
  11/12/15 21:52:03 (pid:14436) **** condor_starter (condor_STARTER) pid 14436 EXITING WITH STATUS 0

Here are the reported problems by the kernel on ldas-grid associated with condor_shadow processes, 

  [root@ldas-grid ~]# grep condor_shadow /var/log/messages
  Nov  9 22:04:21 ldas-grid kernel: Pid: 27825, comm: condor_shadow Not tainted 2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 #1
  Nov 10 02:37:23 ldas-grid kernel: Pid: 30046, comm: condor_shadow Tainted: G        W  -- ------------    2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 #1
  Nov 10 07:46:36 ldas-grid kernel: Pid: 29100, comm: condor_shadow Tainted: G        W  -- ------------    2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 #1
  Nov 10 08:04:42 ldas-grid kernel: Pid: 26765, comm: condor_shadow Tainted: G        W  -- ------------    2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 #1

  Nov 10 19:07:04 ldas-grid kernel: Pid: 16304, comm: condor_shadow Tainted: G        W  -- ------------    2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 #1

  Nov 11 17:56:30 ldas-grid kernel: Pid: 27429, comm: condor_shadow Tainted: G        W  -- ------------    2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 #1
  Nov 11 19:03:59 ldas-grid kernel: Pid: 22028, comm: condor_shadow Tainted: G        W  -- ------------    2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 #1
  Nov 11 21:16:51 ldas-grid kernel: Pid: 14006, comm: condor_shadow Tainted: G        W  -- ------------    2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64 #1

With more detail on one example about the time of your incident, 

  Nov 11 21:44:44 ldas-grid kernel: ------------[ cut here ]------------

Thanks.

-- Stuart Anderson anderson@ligo.caltech.edu http://www.ligo.caltech.edu/~anderson
remarks:
2015-Nov-17 13:13:22 by tpdownes:
(from Stuart)

I am not sure the kernel messages I reported yesterday related condor_shadow failures are indeed already fixed in a newer upstream kernel release so I have just opened the following ticket with RedHat. If that does not result in a definitive answer before Tuesday PM then we will likely push one LDAS-CIT job submit machine to the latest upstream kernel (2.6.32-573.8.1.el6.x86_64), leave one at the current version (2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64) and revert one to the previous version (kernel-2.6.32-573.el6.x86_64) to get more data on this bug.

Note, these messages are happening primarily on the busiest Condor submit machines ldas-grid and ldas-pcdev1, with only 4 occurrences elsewhere, i.e., 

  [root@ldas-grid ~]# for i in ldas-grid ldas-pcdev1 ldas-pcdev3 ldas-pcdev4 emfollow cbc detchar; do echo -n "$i : "; ssh $i "cat /var/log/messages* | grep -c dcache"; done
  ldas-grid : 258
  ldas-pcdev1 : 33
  ldas-pcdev3 : 0
  ldas-pcdev4 : 0
  emfollow : 0
  cbc : 4
  detchar : 0

Note, there are also no dcache kernel messages (from condor_shadow or any other processes) on any of the CIT cluster nodes.

P.S. Juan, I think the simple reason that the newer RH 573.7.1 and 573.8.1 kernel updates are only in the fastbugs repository is that they are simply bug fixes and don’t have any security fixes in them.

Thanks.
